articles.title: ‘In shock’: Wife responds to journo’s death - news.com.au
articles.description: Influential American soccer journalist Grant Wahl died in Qatar while covering the World Cup, his wife has confirmed. He was 48.
articles.content:

articles.title: Automaker Stellantis lays off hundreds of American workers, blaming high cost of making electric cars - Fox Business
articles.description: Stellantis announced its decision to idle operations at an assembly plant in Belvedere, Illinois, next February, resulting in "indefinite layoffs" for workers.

articles.title: China promises to buy more Middle East oil, urges Arab leaders to replace the dollar with yuan - ABC News
articles.description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping vows to import more oil and natural gas from energy-rich Gulf Arab states while not interfering in their affairs, likely seeking to cast Beijing in a more favourable light than Washington as America's attention in the region wanes.

articles.title: Soccer writer Grant Wahl dies at World Cup match in Qatar - CTV News
articles.description: Grant Wahl, an American journalist who helped grow the popularity of soccer in the U.S. and reported on some of the biggest stories in the sport, died Saturday while covering a World Cup match between Argentina and the Netherlands. He was 48.
